clinical_study.brief_title: Use of an Intra Uterine Balloon to Prevent Recurrent Adhesions (REpAIR)
clinical_study.official_title: The Use of Intra Uterine Balloon to Prevent Recurrent Adhesions After Adhesiolysis by Hysteroscopy: Pilot Study

brief_summary.textblock: Patients suffering of subfertility as a consequence of intra uterine adhesions could be treated with adhesiolysis by hysteroscopy. Post-operative recurrent adhesions could be developed. To prevent these recurrent adhesions, an intra uterine balloon is inserted as a barrier. The investigator wants to test if the intra uterine balloon is a good alternative for the current used intra uterine device or gel.

detailed_description.textblock:
Patients suffering of subfertility as a consequence of intra uterine adhesions could be treated with adhesiolysis by hysteroscopy. Post-operative recurrent adhesions could be developped. To prevent these recurrent adhesions, an intra uterine balloon is inserted as a barrier. The investigator wants to test if the intra uterine balloon is a good alternative for the current used intra uterine device or gel.
The investigator wants to include 20 patients with intra uterine adhesions and who need a adhesiolysis by hysteroscopy. The intra uterine balloon will be placed after the adhesiolysis and will be removed after 6 days. During these 6 days an antibiotic cure together with the standard hormone therapy will be administered to the patient. During the 6 days the patients will need to evaluate their pain, the comfort of the balloon, the impact on their daily functioning and their satisfaction.
After 6 days, the balloon will be removed and again a pain score together with a score for the ease of removing the balloon will be collected .
After 8 weeks a second look hysteroscopy will be planned to check the degree of adhesion and if there are any other complications.

study_design_info.intervention_model_description: The aim of this pilot study study is to test if the device is feasible in preventing adhesions to develop again after adhesiolsysis.

primary_outcome.measure: The number of recurrent adhesions after adhesiolysis
The number of complications after adhesiolysis

secondary_outcome.measure: Pain after placement of the intra uterine balloon
secondary_outcome.description: via Visual Analogue Scale (VAS scale). The patient has to indicate her pain score from 0 (no pain) to 10 (worst pain ever).

secondary_outcome.measure: Complications after placement of the intra uterine balloon
Pain at the time of the removal of the intra uterine balloon
secondary_outcome.description: via Visual Analogue Scale (VAS scale). The patient has to indicate her pain score from 0 (no pain) to 10 (worst pain ever).

secondary_outcome.measure: Patient Satisfaction after removal of the intra uterine balloon
Malaise after placement of the intra uterine balloon
Daily functioning after placement of the intra uterine balloon (absence from work, impact on work productivity, impact on household, physical activity, daily life)
secondary_outcome.description: Via questionnaire and via via Visual Analogue Scale (VAS scale). The patient has to indicate her daily functioning from 0 (the balloon had no influence on my daily function) to 10 (because of the balloon I couldn't do anything of my daily work).

secondary_outcome.measure: The ease of inserting the intra uterine balloon
secondary_outcome.time_frame: once at the time of the surgical procedure (adhesiolysis). This is day 0 of the study

secondary_outcome.measure: The ease of removing the intra uterine balloon

intervention.description: An intra uterine Cook balloon will be placed after adhesiolysis to prevent recurrent adhesions after adhesiolysis by hysteroscopy.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- patients with intra uterine adhesions or Asherman syndrome who need adhesiolysis

eligibility.gender_description: Only female patients will be included
